alert.note: Alert for Cattaraugus (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL CATTARAUGUS COUNTY THROUGH 100 AM EDT... At 1214 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Ashford, or 9 miles north of Salamanca, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salamanca, Allegany State Park, Ashford, Franklinville, Ashford Hollow, Great Valley, New Albion, Randolph, Napoli, Little Valley, Delevan, East Otto, Cattaraugus, Ischua, Otto, Lyndon, Humphrey, East Randolph, Ellicottville, and Kill Buck. This includes Interstate 86 between exits 15 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. The cluster of storms has a history of generating one to one and a half inches of rain in les than an hour. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
